name: drum-kit
definition: A drum kit is a collection of drums and other percussion instruments set up to be played by a single player.
description:
The drum kit is a collection of instruments including drums and cymbals and other additional instruments that are grouped together and played by one musician.

The traditional drum kit consists of a mix of drums and idiophones. More recently kits have also included electronic instruments, with both hybrid and entirely electronic kits now in common use.

The drum kit emerged in the 1800s when a musician in an orchestra was required to play more than one instrument, most often the cymbals, triangle, and bass drum.

The drum kit can be divided into four main sections including the hardware (drum stands, pedals, and cymbal stands), the extensions (chimes, tambourines, cowbells, other non-standard instruments), the shells (toms and bass drum), and the breakables (stool, snare drum, cymbals, sticks, and bass drum pedal).

Kit drumming, whether playing accompaniment of voices and other instruments or doing a drum solo, consists of two elements: a groove which sets the basic timefeel and drum fills which provide variety and add interest to the drum sound.

Drum kits can come in different configurations such as three piece sets, four piece drum kit with floor tom, four piece drum kit with two hanging toms, five piece sets, cocktail kit, and extended kit.

The musician typically uses drum sticks in his hands and pedals at his feet to strike the various instruments.

facts.name: The three piece drum kit is for young drummers
facts.value: The three piece drum kit is common for young drummers or when space is limited.

facts.name: Five piece drum kits
facts.value: Five piece drum kits are the most common drum kits and have three toms in total and often have effects cymbals added.

facts.name: Drum kit can be shared between several drummers
facts.value: When a drum kit is shared between several drummers, which happens if more than one band is playing on stage in one night, the 'breakables' of the drum kit are usually swapped out between drummers so that they can use their own.

facts.name: Sound effects on silent movies
facts.value: Drummers in the 1920s foley artists became important for silent film makers. The drummer was the individual hired to create the sound effects for the films such as galloping horses, trains arriving, gun shots, and flying planes.

facts.name: The extended drum kit can include many more cymbals
facts.value: The extended drum kit can include many more cymbals, drums, and additional instruments.

facts.name: The modern drum kit was made popular in the 1920s
facts.value: The modern drum kit that most people recognize today was made popular in the 1920s in New Orleans in the Vaudeville era.

facts.name: The cocktail kit is often only two pieces
facts.value: The cocktail kit is often only two pieces but the drums are often regular size.

facts.name: Drum kits first became popular military bands
facts.value: Drum kits first became popular military bands and then in jazz music.

facts.name: The four piece drum kit
facts.value: The four piece drum kit with two hanging toms has two hanging toms and is common when space is limited.

facts.name: Components of the modern drum kit
facts.value: The main components of the modern drum kit include the snare drum, toms, bass drum, octobans, ride cymbals, hi-hats, crashes, effects cymbals, and additional instruments such as cowbells, wood blocks, gongs, chimes, triangles, tambourines, timbales, brake drums, buckets, and tubular bells, and many others.
